body: bro why you gonna do me in like that :/
There's always a twist, and somehow, this is the least scary one.
The ending just makes ur pp soft
Welp, this one left me with a bad taste in my mouth, not that the story is bad or anything.
Ngl, coming from Ichihaya, that title is hella unnerving
On one hand she loves you enough to act like a kid on the other well are you okay with living knowing the fact that you've been left behind and living a lie?
How lucky  Tarou is to have someone who loves him deeply that she's willing to act like a child for his sake.
Damn homie I don't know if he'll be coming around again anytime soon now
@Pluthermal Love your work, keep good at it :)
Gotta say the loli deserves some respect in some ways.
the discussion that ichiya's work produces will always amaze me. indeed, pornography brings people together.

[Afterward]
Hey, Ishihaya here.
You know, Peter-Pan-syndrome is particularly common in male.
Hun? You didn't? Well, it is nothing related to this book though.

I drew this as the opposite of the alien-story that I made last time.
I have made this kind of stories before, but those stories have a meaning of why heroine is middle-schooler, not elementary-schooler or high-schooler.
(Because if she is too young or old, the story won't work so.)
So I will continue to make these stuff sometimes.

But kids are kids after all, so I think that they are shallow.

I tried to add translatation for the character profile and afterward.

[Profile]
Nakae Otoka(15) (Yes, translater-san mistook her name.)
Birthday: September 4th
Likes: Bear (She just leave it at that.)
Hates: Green pepper (She just leave it at that.)
Breasts: Actually pretty big....

A childish childhood friend.
Her grades are outstanding and she is the captain of the tennis club, the president of the school council, and the admiration of her schoolmates.
But she had turned down virtually every invitations to hang out.
And this mystery makes her even more popular (In her all-girls-school, ofcourse).

She is too overprotective and possessive, and that's why she loves Tarou.
They have known each other since she was born, and visited each other's home often.
She likes being short in height.

[Afterward]
Hey, Ishihaya here.
You know, Peter-Pan-syndrome is particularly common in male.
Hun? You didn't? Well, it is nothing related to this book though.

I drew this as the opposite of the alien
I came, but at what cost ?
At least she loves you enough to embarrass herself to that extent, bro.
pretty sure this is one of the few most mild scary ending out of all of ichihaya doujins
Goddamn you ichihaya
I actually teared up on this one;  bitter sweet endings hits different.  It's quite rare to see them these days but they make my cock feel sad as well, you win you lose

@I woner why I totally agree with everything you state and won't mind long analytics, since i'm a huge fan of ichihaya and a lot of his work just lead me to so much thoughts (like the amnesia sister one). Every time i read an ichihaya work i'm fascinated how we just build to ourself an assumption and that assumption got completely broken down by the twist. Such a waste that we don't get the translation for the character profile at the end, sometimes it shows us a lot of incredible details

Mmm, yeah, this one is quite sad. I'd probably identify 2 parts to the cause. The first, would be how the mc has been "left behind" and has become a sort of outcast, which on its own, isn't a huge problem, which leads us to the second part.  The second part would be Otoha pretending to be a child to "give him a place to belong", but by deceiving him, reality hit him harder when it's all revealed, and really drove home the fact that he's the only one who hasn't changed, and the only one who hasn't moved on in life. There's also the part where she has no real intention of helping him, and seems to love him the way he is. Which, well, includes the trait that is commonly perceived as a flaw: immaturity, which I could go on another tangent about. Honestly, it didn't really hit me all that hard until I saw the mc's final thoughts. But I agree that this could have hit a lot harder with some more backstory. Anywho, I could go on, but this isn't really the place for in-depth analysis, lol
Hey another Immortal Loli

I really dislike how this translator group doesn't even translate the character profile in the end!

I hope there are going to be better alternate translations in the future.

This is one of a kind case where the main problem ain't like some damn alien like the other doujins, but just needed character development for The MC, best route for the next sequel should be the man admitting himself that he should grow up and try to be an adult that can take care of her and make her happy, but judging its ichihaya I'm not too sure lol
Man this one hit kinda hard

@Marushu
How is this depressing? Unless you count the guy hearing about his immaturity from his lover unintentionally, of course. If anything, it’s quite upbeat considering she explicitly stated she wants to spend her life with him.
Ichihaya once again with the depressing twists that make my pp sad.
